page.title: MuscleLib API Documentation
page.heading: MuscleLib API
headset.description: Welcome to the MuscleLib API documentation. Explore our endpoints and access a comprehensive database of exercises to enhance your fitness applications.
developer.first.description: Simple and intuitive API, easy to integrate with any language or platform.
restful.api.description: Well-structured and predictable endpoints to simplify data consumption.
high.performance.description: Fast and efficient responses, ensuring minimal latency.
extensive.exercise.database.description: Comprehensive exercise library with illustrative images stored in a CDN for quick loading.
muscle.targeting.description: Each exercise includes detailed information about the primary and secondary muscles worked.
no.api.key.required.description: Direct access to the API without authentication, making integration hassle-free.
multilingual.support.description: Support for multiple languages, ensuring global accessibility.
open.source.description: MuscleLib API is open-source. Check out the source code on github.
free.tier.description: Free access for testing, no payment required.
terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.heading: MuscleLib API Terms of Service
privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.heading: MuscleLib API Privacy Policy
overview.description: Start building your project using the MuscleLib API
overview.base_url_description: All of the endpoints are prefixed with the base URL. The base URL for the MuscleLib API is:
endpoints.all_exercises_description: Retrieve a list of all exercises available in the database. This endpoint supports various query parameters for filtering and pagination.
endpoints.lang_description: Language for response. Default is en. Supported values: en, pt.
endpoints.fields_description: Comma-separated list of fields to return e.g.: (name,instructions).
endpoints.page_description: Page number for pagination must be an integer ≥ 1. Default is 1.
endpoints.limit_description: Number of items to return per page. Must be an integer ≥ 1. Default is 10.
endpoints.dynamic_filters_description: Apply filters based on exercise attributes. Example: (level=expert&force=push&primaryMuscles=chest).
endpoints.search_description: The endpoint allows users to search for exercises in the MuscleLib API database. This endpoint supports various query parameters to filter and paginate the results, making the search more efficient and personalized.
endpoints.exercise_images_description: The endpoint allows users to retrieve images associated with exercises from the MuscleLib API. Each exercise has its images stored in a specific directory.
endpoints.image_structure_description: Exercise images are organized in folders, where each folder corresponds to an exercise. Inside each folder, there are two images named 0.jpg and 1.jpg.
